Don’t miss our weekly town hall!WATCHClose11Please ensure Javascript is enabled for purposes of website accessibilityEl Paso ranks #1 city in U.S. for housing affordability, study findsby Erika EsquivelThu, October 2, 2025 at 8:33 AMUpdated Thu, October 2, 2025 at 8:34 AMSan AntonioTexas suburban housing development neighborhood - aerial view with houses in rows in middle-class neighborhoodComment on this story2CommentShare storySharetopics: El PasoHousing affordabilityMedian incomeRentersHomeownersSmartAssetHousing costsMiamiEL PASO, Texas (KFOX14/CBS4) — El Paso was ranked as the number one city in the U.S. for housing affordability, according to a study. SmartAsset’s latest study ranked U.S. cities based on housing costs as a portion of the local median income, with costs broken out for both renters and homeowners.El Paso ranked no. 1 overall, with 20.35% of household median income going to putting roofs over heads. According to the study, just 20.35% of household income goes to housing costs in El Paso, where the average monthly cost across both renters and homeowners is $1,016. Renters pay a median $985 per month compared to homeowners at $1,066, with a $59,932 median income across all households. Residents in Louisville, KY (20.38%); Albuquerque, NM (20.38%); Mesa, AZ (20.54%); and Indianapolis, IN (21.82%) also pay some of the lowest portions of their incomes to housing.For Miami residents, more than 36% of gross income goes to housing costs. Miami is the most expensive city for housing studywide, with homeowners paying a median of $2,025 in monthly costs and renters paying $1,975, compared to a median household income of $66,337. Costs for homeowners actually decreased year over year, but rent increases overshadowed this since two thirds of households in Miami rent.Below is the list of the cities with the highest house affordability. Miami, FL Los Angeles, CA Long Beach, CA New York, NY Oakland, CA Boston, MA Detroit, MI Baltimore, MD Tampa, FL San Diego, CA Memphis, TN Houston, TX Atlanta, GA Dallas, TX Austin, TXSee the full study here.RECOMMENDED: El Paso city council reviews progress on 'Envision El Paso' plan for future developmentComment with BubblesREAD THE COMMENTS (2)Sign up to receive the top interesting stories from in and around our community once daily in your inbox.TrendingErika Kirk opens up about wishing for pregnancy after husband's tragic assassinationKirk joined Megyn Kelly for a live interview on the last stop of Kelly's Sirius XM tour in Glendale, Arizona.
